result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:30 PM 2021CM000074, 2021CM000139, 2022CF000102, 2022CM000030, 2022CM000123 - Defendant Regina Marie Heather in court.  Attorney Adrian W Longacre in court for Regina Marie Heather.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Longacre state that they have a resolution to enter a plea on count 1 of 22CF102. All other counts and cases will be DRI. Attorney Longacre provides the court with the plea questionnaire. Court colloquy.  Court finds probable cause. RH enters a plea of NC. Attorney Harper and Attorney Longacre heard. 


Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 3 years.

Conditions:
6 months conditional jail time in the Richland County Jail to begin on or before 11/05/22. 
Huber and EMT granted.

Attend and successfully complete the Richland County Drug Court.

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.

Obey all rules and regulations of the department.
 
Costs waived.

Credit in the event of revocation: Parties stipulate to 31 days.

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.

Sign up for probation today

Firearm warnings given.

All other counts and cases will be DRI.

Prior: 360 N. Park St.  Apt. 1, Richland Center, WI 53581

Court speaks about bail motion that was filed by Attorney Longacre in case 22CF102. Attorney Longacre speaks about his motion and states that RH has a place to go; request a signature bond. Attorney Harper states the RH has been accepted into drug court. Attorney Longacre comments. 

Court orders: upon release to the TLP the defendant will be on a $1,000 signature bond. Defendant will be on house arrest except to seek employment or for treatment.
